So, for each j, the pairs within this row (same first char) that differ in the second character would contribute alphas1[i,j] * sum of other entries in the row. But since for each pair (j and j'), the product is counted twice (once when j is considered and once when j' is considered), the code adds all possible pairs and divides by 2. So for each row, the number of pairs that differ in the second character is the sum over j of alphas1[i,j] * (RowSum - alphas1[i,j]), divided by 2.
